txt.en: 'And pray pardon me! I thought --'
'You thought I remained in Meduseld, hunched like an old tree beneath winter snow.'
'So it was when you went to war. But a wind from the west has shaken the boughs....'
'Come, Ceorl, and despair no longer! Let us ride to Erkenbrand's aid!'
'Does Éomer ride with you?'
'No, Théoden! You must ride at once to Helm's Deep!'
'At last you come, but too late. Alas! You bring too little strength.'
'Do not go to the Fords of Isen, and tarry not on the plain!'
'I must leave -- Shadowfax must bear me on a swift errand.'
'All has gone evilly since Théodred fell. Yesterday we lost the Isen, and many good men with it.'
'Aragorn, Éomer: Keep well the Lord of the Mark, until I return.'
'Please, where is Éomer?'
'Wait for me at Helm's Gate! Farewell!'
'Tell him that no hope lies ahead.'
Háma
'He should turn back to Edoras, before the warriors of Isengard come there.'
'Come, Ceorl, and stand before me! I am here.'
'The last host of Eorlingas rides forth, and it shall not return without battle.'
'Command me, my king!'
'What could that mean?'
'I suspect it means that Gandalf Grayhame has need of haste. Ever he comes and goes unlooked-for.'
'If Wormtongue were here, he would not find it hard to explain.'
'I suppose that is true...but for myself, I shall wait until we see Gandalf again.'
'Perhaps you will wait long....'
